text: is a Japanese city in Shizuoka Prefecture on the island of Honshū. It has been recognized as a special city since 2000.Jacobs, A.J. "Japan's Evolving Nested Municipal Hierarchy: The Race for Local Power in the 2000s," Urban Studies Research (2011), Table 3. Retrieved 2012-12-18. ==History== In the Edo period, Numazu-juku and Hara-juku was the 12th and 13th of 53 shogunate-maintained waystations (shuku-eki) along the Tōkaidō road which connected Edo and Kyoto.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Tōkaidō" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 973. Both Tōkaidō rest stops are within the boundaries of modern Numazu. ==Related pages== * The Fifty-three Stations of the Tōkaidō ==References== ==Other websites== * http://www.city.numazu.shizuoka.jp/living_in/english.htm , Category:Cities in Shizuoka Prefecture
title: Numazu
